text: Tridrepana obliquitaenia is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Warren in 1922. It is widely distributed in New Guinea.The Hooktips (Drepanidae, Drepaninae) of Papua Indonesia The wingspan is about 35.2-41.8 mm for males. Adults are easily distinguished from related species by the colour pattern of the upperside. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1922 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of New Guinea
title: Tridrepana obliquitaenia
